KCIC: Enam Investor Minati Proyek Hunian di TOD Halim
06 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Yohanes Paskalis, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia Cina (KCIC) menggenjot pengembangan hunian terintegrasi (transit oriented development/TOD) yang paketnya menyatu dengan proyek jalur Kereta Cepat Jakarta-Bandung. Direktur TOD dan Legal KCIC, Dwi Windarto, menargetkan investasi ke properti terintegrasi kereta kencang itu mulai mengalir tahun depan.
"Masing-masing harus sudah pemodal, makanya kami terus jajaki," ucapnya kepada Tempo di kawasan Kemayoran, Jakarta Pusat, Rabu 6 November 2019 .
Pengembangan TOD yang umumnya meliputi apartemen dan pusat belanja itu terbagi di empat stasiun pemberhentian kereta cepat Jakarta-Bandung, dengan total kebutuhan lahan 1.862 hektare. Saat ini, kata Dwi, baru Stasiun Halim (Jakarta) dan Stasiun Walini (Jawa Barat) yang siap dikerjakan. Sementara Stasiun Karawang dan Stasiun Tegalluar masih memerlukan pembebasan lahan.
"Halim yang hanya seluas 2,6 hektare saja sudah dilirik enam investor," ujarnya tanpa menyebut nama entitas. Dia meyakini sebagian TOD sudah terbangun saat kereta cepat meluncur pada 2021.
Segala target kerja kereta cepat Jakarta-Bandung inilah yang sebelumnya menginisiasi pembentukan task force atau satuan tugas khusus. Dengan membahas realisasi setiap dua pekan, Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara Erick Thohir yakin dapat memangkas hambatan yang bisa menunda proyek.
Direktur Utama PT KCIC, Chandra Dwiputra, mengatakan satgas yang dipimpinnya itu melibatkan para pimpinan BUMN, termasuk PT Pertamina (persero) dan PT PLN (persero). "Masalah lapangan lebih cepat dituntaskan," ucapnya.
Maksud Chandra adalah koordinasi penanganan objek vital di sekitar jalur konstruksi kereta cepat, seperti relokasi pipa penyalur bahan bakar Pertamina yang sempat bocor akibat aktivitas pengeboran. Ada juga komunikasi untuk pemindahan saluran listrik udara (SUTET) yang melintang.
Menurut dia, KCIC terbuka pada investor manapun, termasuk pengembang kawasan. Pemodal KCIC, PT Pilar Sinergi BUMN Indonesia (PSBI), kini beranggotakan PT Kereta Api Indonesia, PT Wijaya Karya Tbk, PT Jasa Marga Tbk, dan PT Perkebunan Nusantara VIII. "Sekarang ada TOD yang bukan bidang mereka, jadi butuh support lagi."
Perusahaan mengupayakan agar pengerjaan sarana dan prasarana proyek mendekati 50 persen pada akhir tahun ini. Di awal pengoperasian nanti, KCIC menyediakan 11 rangkaian kereta berkecepatan 350 kilometer/jam. Setiap rangkaian terdiri dari delapan gerbong yang melayani tiga kelas penumpang.
Deputi Bidang Sarana dan Prasarana Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Nasional, Kennedy Simanjuntak, mengatakan proyek tersebut hanya menyisakan konstruksi jika sudah membebaskan sisa kebutuhan lahan. Terdapat tiga bidang seluas satu kilometer persegi di Kota Bandung yang pembebasannya diproses di Mahkamah Agung. "Kalau lahan dan dana beres, kita tinggal menagih penyelesaian."

CAESAR AKBAR | DIAS PRASONGKO | YOHANES PASKALIS PAE DALE

KCIC: Six Investors Interested in Residential Projects at TOD Halim
06 Nov 2019, 23:45 by Yohanes Paskalis, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT China Fast Train Indonesia (KCIC) is promoting the development of integrated transit (development oriented development / TOD) which is integrated with the Jakarta-Bandung Fast Train track project. KCIC's Director of TOD and Legal, Dwi Windarto, is targeting investment in the integrated high-speed train property to begin flowing next year.
"Each of them must have been financiers, so we continue to explore," he said to Tempo in the Kemayoran area, Central Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
The TOD development, which generally includes apartments and shopping centers, is divided into four Jakarta-Bandung rapid train stop stations, with a total land requirement of 1,862 hectares. At present, Dwi said, only Halim Station (Jakarta) and Walini Station (West Java) are ready to work. While Karawang Station and Tegalluar Station still require land acquisition.
"Halim, which is only 2.6 hectares wide, has been attracted by six investors," he said without mentioning the name of the entity. He believes most of the TOD was awakened when the fast train rolled in 2021.
All of these Jakarta-Bandung fast train work targets were previously initiated to form task forces or special task forces. By discussing the realization every two weeks, Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Erick Thohir believes he can cut barriers that could delay the project.
PT KCIC Managing Director, Chandra Dwiputra, said the task force he led involved SOE leaders, including PT Pertamina (Persero) and PT PLN (Persero). "Field problems are more quickly resolved," he said.
Chandra's intention was to coordinate the handling of vital objects around the high-speed train construction path, such as the relocation of Pertamina's fuel pipelines that had leaked due to drilling activities. There is also communication for the transference of transverse air power lines (SUTET).
According to him, KCIC is open to any investor, including regional developers. KCIC financier, PT Pilar Sinergi BUMN Indonesia (PSBI), now consists of PT Kereta Api Indonesia, PT Wijaya Karya Tbk, PT Jasa Marga Tbk, and PT Perkebunan Nusantara VIII. "Now there is a TOD that is not in their field, so we need more support."
The company strives to make project facilities and infrastructure close to 50 percent by the end of this year. At the beginning of the operation, KCIC provided 11 train lines with a speed of 350 kilometers / hour. Each series consists of eight cars that serve three classes of passengers.
Deputy for Facilities and Infrastructure of the National Development Planning Agency, Kennedy Simanjuntak, said the project would only leave construction if it had freed the remaining land needs. There are three areas of one square kilometer in the city of Bandung, whose exemptions are processed in the Supreme Court. "If the land and funds are in order, all we have to do is ask for a settlement."

CAESAR AKBAR | DIAS PRASONGKO | JOHN PASCHALIS PAE DALE
